messages.message:
Woot Microsoft!

@Aaron Tami does coordinate reporting work even when rotation correction is on? Making sure that is working before we ship to customers will save downstream support requests

what do you mean coordinate reporting? Like for provenance tracking? Microsoft does the rotations for us, so we don't do any rotations of our own, so I'm not sure if we have the proper coordinate reporting.
We just need to make sure that the coordinates reported in the ibocr are always correct (even if rotation was performed)
Eg let’s say the word poly in an ibocr has xy,xy
No matter what rotation correction was performed, when we inspect that region of the image, we should get the image region corresponding to that actual word
This is super important for surprise weird things to not happen downstream

(There is a separate convo about returning to four coordinate polys instead of two coordinate to capture rotated boxes, but that’s less important than just making sure the coordinate translation is applied
Actually i take that back, we do do post ocr rotation, so it should work correctly
it should behave like all the other OCRs wrt coordinates
